intro: Hypocyrta gracilis, commonly known as the slender hypocras, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which are followed by small, berry-like fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical environments, often growing in shaded, moist habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
